books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: The Mystery of Orcival
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A countess is murdered and suspects are quickly detained, but Lecoq is not satisfied and looks in a different direction to solve the case.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.

books.title: Murder in the Gunroom
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A private detective is called upon to evaluate a gun collection that contains a dark secret.

books.title: Human Nature and Conduct
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: Dewey applies the theory of pragmatism to morality, reason, and society.

books.title: Dialogues
books.author: Plato
books.summary: A collection of Plato’s dialogues.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: John Keats
books.summary: A collection of John Keats’ published poems, and a selection of unpublished fragments and posthumous verse.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: Four-Day Planet
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A young reporter gets caught up in intrigue and adventure chasing tallow-wax bounties with the monster hunters on Fenris, a planet with a two-thousand-hour day and four-day year.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
